image.altText: A pipe bomb outside on the ground

props.synopsis: The discovery of 15 explosive devices along footpaths near a Canberra lake shocked residents this week, raising questions about how the devices came to be there and who could be responsible.

title.children: What we know about the pipe bombs found in Canberra this week

image.altText: A metal pipe bomb post-detonation laying on leaf-littered ground.

props.synopsis: ACT police say they have found four more pipe bombs in the Belconnen area, after 11 explosive devices were discovered close to Lake Ginninderra earlier in the week.

title.children: Four more pipe bombs found in Canberra as probe continues

image.altText: The exteior of a modern apartment block.

props.synopsis: Large glazed windows are a popular design flaw in Australian apartments, according to an expert.

title.children: Why apartments with floor-to-ceiling windows are a 'trade-off' in Australia

image.altText: A children's toy bear laying sideways on a floor.

props.synopsis: Documents detailing five years' worth of childcare breaches in the ACT reveal cases of educators slapping children, forcibly shaking them, throwing them, and possessing child exploitation material.

title.children: 'She was slapped': Inappropriate childcare educator discipline exposed

image.altText: A colourful children's toy block lies sideways in front of a colourful abacus.

props.synopsis: Never-before-seen documents reveal reports of sexual abuse, inappropriate educator discipline, and children missing from ACT childcare centres.

title.children: Thousands of documents show behind the scenes of embattled childcare industry

image.altText: A composite of luxury jewellery including rings and watches.

props.synopsis: Lawyers say the value of the allegedly stolen luxury goods, including a $5 million Richard Mille watch, is disputed as the case returns to court.

title.children: Two French men to plead guilty over alleged $10m theft in Canberra

image.altText: A small boat moored at a marina.

props.synopsis: Living at Brisbane’s Kangaroo Point overlooking the river would typically come with a hefty price tag, but some residents have found an alternative.

title.children: Renters swapping apartments for boats for inner-city living at $500 a week

image.altText: dark clouds hover kurnell in sydney

props.synopsis: January is the middle of Australia's severe weather season and a multitude of hazards are emerging across the country this weekend.

title.children: Rain and cyclone threat in weekend of weather hazards across Australia

image.altText: Cars swept away by flood waters seen from a police aircraft on Thursday.

props.synopsis: Emergency services have defended warning times as locals recover from the record-breaking rains and worst floods in the area since the 80s.

title.children: Clean-up continues along Great Ocean Road after disastrous floods

image.altText: Lance Armstrong holds his chin

props.synopsis: Lance Armstrong had successfully doped for years. But when the evidence backed him into a corner he took control of the narrative and confessed live on Oprah's couch, martyring himself to cycling's EPO era.

title.children: Lance Armstong destroyed his legacy with five monosyllabic answers to Oprah

image.altText: A besuited man speaks into a small microphone at a table.

props.synopsis: The US president insists America needs to acquire the territory of NATO partner Denmark for national security reasons.

title.children: Trump threatens tariffs on countries who oppose US Greenland takeover

image.altText: A man wearing a navy suit stands in front of media microphones speaking and gesticulating.

props.synopsis: The dramatic cancellation of Adelaide Writers' Week spiralled the news cycle out of Premier Peter Malinauskas's control. But will the saga actually mean anything come the March state election?

title.children: The SA premier faced one of his most bruising weeks yet. Will it matter come election time?

image.altText: Nicholas Taylor wears a black t-shirt and sits front-on to the camera.

props.synopsis: Nicholas Taylor told a court last year that he was abused as a student at a Hobart Catholic school in the 1970s and 1980s. One of his alleged abusers was former Test cricket umpire Stephen Randell.

title.children: 'It played enough on my life': Victim-survivor reveals identity to help others

image.altText: Sarah Blizzard gives a thumbs up to the camera with a crowd of people behind her.

props.synopsis: With hopes of reaching the Winter Olympics fading due to a dodgy bobsleigh, the Dutch team were running out of answers until Australian Sarah Blizzard rode to the rescue and helped the Netherlands' sliders achieve their dreams.

title.children: With a team's Olympic hopes at risk, this Aussie stepped in to help

image.altText: Campbell Harrison and boyfriend Justin Maire share a kiss in the climbing gym

props.synopsis: Campbell Harrison was homophobically trolled in the lead-up to the Paris Olympics. It strengthened his conviction about the importance of visible queer role models in sport.

title.children: Why this Olympian is proud to be a gay role model despite trolling

image.altText: A cricket player in pink raises his bat and helmet in celebration of a century

props.synopsis: Steve Smith smashes 32 runs from a single over after denying Babar Azam the strike, leaving the star Pakistan recruit less than impressed.

title.children: Smith breaks BBL record and outduels Warner as Pakistan teammate fumes

image.altText: A man in a suit frowns while sitting in a court setting

props.synopsis: Former South Korean president Yoon Suk Yeol is sentenced to five years in jail over crimes relating to his failed attempt at imposing martial law in the country.

title.children: Former South Korean president jailed over martial law declaration

image.altText: A boy stands in front of a white doglike dragon with stars in the background

props.synopsis: Every question has only two options: One is right and the other is wrong. You have an even chance of guessing correctly each time.

title.children: 50/50 quiz: Test your knowledge of The Neverending Story, cocktails and 90s lyrics

image.altText: A boxer looks perplexed in a ring with people around him

props.synopsis: Nikita Tszyu and Michael Zerafa hotly anticipated fight is abandoned after the second round as the crowd vents its frustration at the Brisbane Entertainment Centre.

title.children: Tszyu accuses 'cowardly' Zefara of quitting after grudge match called off

image.altText: Nelson Asofa-Solomona stands over a fallen Jeremy Latimore in the boxing ring.

props.synopsis: Nelson Asofa-Solomona calls out his former rugby league competitors after making a successful transition to the fight game by knocking out Jeremy Latimore.

title.children: Asofa-Solomona plans to 'clean up the whole NRL division' after boxing debut

image.altText: Julio Iglesias stands smiling and wearing a suit and tie. People in the background are taking his photo.

props.synopsis: The Spanish recording artist is accused of sexually and physically assaulting two women who worked at his residences in the Dominican Republic and the Bahamas between January and October 2021.

title.children: Singer Julio Iglesias denies sexually assaulting two former employees

image.altText: A close up of a People First Bank Calendar which says "Putting people first since 1875"

props.synopsis: People First Bank announces it will shut 18 sites, saying customers are choosing digital services, but for some regional Australians, in‑person banking remains essential.

title.children: People First Bank branch closures spark concern and confusion

image.altText: Three emergency tents in Kyiv, give a warm glow against the night sky.

props.synopsis: International aid agencies say children across Ukraine risk hypothermia in freezing temperatures as emergency stocks of power generators run low following Russian attacks on energy infrastructure.

title.children: Children in Ukraine risk hypothermia after Russian attacks, aid groups say

image.altText: an aerial image of a water race course

props.synopsis: A water ski racing group has planned an alleged unsanctioned racing event in South Australia, which the state's Department for Infrastructure and Transport says it has not approved. It comes as the peak body for the sport has nationally suspended racing due to safety concerns.

title.children: Unauthorised ski racing event threatens 'death of the sport' after suspension

image.altText: An elder man wearing a cowboy hat smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: After 54 years coordinating the Tamworth Country Music Festival, Barry Harley explains it wasn't the drawling tunes that hooked him — but the "family" he made along the way.

title.children: He didn't love country music, but Barry Harley still became the boss of Tamworth

image.altText: A smiling, older man in religious garb stands with Anthony Albanese, dressed in a dark suiit, in a church.

props.synopsis: A broad of coalition of Australia's most influential religious leaders have urged the prime minister to scrap Labor's proposal to outlaw the promotion of racial hatred.

title.children: Top faith leaders urge PM to scrap new racial hatred offence

image.altText: A young man in blue walking with head down

props.synopsis: The man accused of assaulting former Labor strategist Tim Picton allegedly knocked another man unconscious two days prior.

title.children: Tim Picton's alleged attacker accused of another assault, posting it on Snapchat

image.altText: A white ship sits still on the ocean at a port against a blue sky

props.synopsis: Tokyo hopes the plan to mine as much as 16 million tonnes of rare earths will help reduce its reliance on China, but will it work?

title.children: Japan wants to mine the seabed at a depth of 6 kilometres for one reason: China

image.altText: People being moved off a wooden boat onto an inflatable boat.

props.synopsis: Locals on Queensland's far north tip have shared their account after seeing an Indonesian fishing boat within a stone's throw of the mainland.

title.children: Foreign fishing vessel filmed 100m away from Queensland coast

image.altText: A building shaped like round white ball surrounded by ice.

props.synopsis: Here is what we know about the US military footprint in Greenland, and how the increase of troops from Denmark and its allies stacks up.

title.children: Once top secret, Greenland's only US military base is stirring trouble

image.altText: A handing holding a gold replica of the Nobel Peace Medal

props.synopsis: While it can be gifted, refused or displayed, the Nobel Peace Prize itself — once awarded — belongs to its original recipient forever.

title.children: Can Machado actually transfer the Nobel Peace Prize to Trump?

image.altText: Maddison Inglis walking onto the court and waving to the crowd

props.synopsis: Maddison Inglis and Jason Kubler were able to celebrate their Australian Open qualifications together in a heartwarming moment.

title.children: Engaged Aussie tennis stars qualify for Open within an hour of each other

image.altText: A person leans on an oval fence while kids stand nearby with bikes in front of a large round hole in the green grass.

props.synopsis: The state's road building authority says a planned test should have been aborted given the circumstances, as tunnelling recommences for the North-East Link tunnel project.

title.children: Melbourne sinkhole caused by test that 'should not have taken place'

image.altText: A wasp nest inside a tree trunk

props.synopsis: An enormous 40-litre nest of European wasps is discovered on the south coast of WA — the last frontier for the invasive species in Australia.

title.children: Large nest of invasive wasps found in WA suburb

image.altText: Chief Minister Lia Finocchiaro and David Connolly standing in cattle yards

props.synopsis: A history of questionable social media posts from the NT's next administrator David Connolly have emerged, but the chief minister say she stands by her nomination of him.

title.children: Questionable social media posts by next NT administrator emerge
